title: Youtube playlist won't autoplay when I use adblocker
content: Recently I've been on youtube a lot with playlist as my background but one day out of nowhere the playlist would stop between songs. I figured out that when I have the adblocker disabled for the window that's playing youtube that the error goes away. The problem is that if I open another window and adblocker is active the window playing youtube recognizes it and stops the autoplay. This happens even when I have youtube playing on a private window. how can I get this to stop? I want to be able to leave a window with youtbe playing and not have to press play every time and still browse the internet.
creator: agutier2

title: Firefox or an open pinned tab repeatedly crashes
content:
I am a Firefox user on both of my own computers, but also install it on all systems I support remotely. On one of those the user is a heavy FF user with multiple pinned tabs. This worked without issues for a very long time. However, since V 106 (I don't know it his is related) FF and/or individual tabs frequently crash (on start, or later), offers to restore session or tab, is successful, but then the whole sequence repeats. We have taken all troubleshooting steps, including disabling all extensions, and starting in safe mode, but to no avail.

The system in question runs WINDOWS10 (Home), 64 bit, V 22H2 (newest upgrade) and all patches applied.

Any help or suggestions would be hugely appreciated.

Willem Overbeeke
creator: willem.overbeeke

title: cannot login to Shopify Admin pages
content:
I am unable to login to my Shopify Websites on firefox. Other browsers work. Private Windows don't work either. I've disabled all add-ons and extensions and had AVAST deactivate all virus and security software and retest and it still doesn't work. I've been advised by AVAST that It seems that the browser settings and it's local cache may have conflict with the websites.

I've attached a screenshot to show that the "button" stays greyed out and is not selectable.

I will also mention that i think i saw spme text in the bottom left of the browser indicating there was a problem with "recaptcha" but didn't get a screen shot of that. Does firefox have an issue with captcha?

title: Firefox View is not showing!
content:
Firefox view is a new feature that looks awesome and I'd love to try it out to sync stuff between devices. There's just one problem:

  1. Firefox view works on my laptop and seems to work on my phone, but does not work on my desktop.

For reference:

  • Desktop (doesn't have view tab) is Mac Mini 2020 (M1) on Mac OS Ventura 13.0 (22A380)
  • Laptop (has view tab) is Mac Mini 2020 (M1) on Mac OS Ventura 13.0 (22A380)
  • Both devices are running Firefox 106.0.2 (64-bit)

I have already:

  • Made sure "Open Tabs" is enabled for sync on all devices
  • Looked for the firefox view in the "Customize Toolbar" menu
  • Disabled / Re-enabled Firefox-View in about:config

title: Firefox looks like it is crashing the tab due to videos.
content:
Firefox has not been playing nice, and it is starting to worry me that if I continue to use it, my computer may suffer damage due to crashes.

It only seem to happen when I'm playing videos, such from YouTube and Twitch. It causes most of the time the tab to crash and require me to simply reload the page. There have been 2 times however that it has caused Windows OS to completely crash, requiring a restart. I have a picture of the error codes present, but one thing is shared between them. They all contain the reason EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ. This has pointed me to consider it to be the same issue. It may also be a issue with the new computer itself, or maybe something to do with the graphics card. I'll start with this first to see if it's something bigger or not.

I also hope that the trouble shooting data can also help, as I rather know how to fix this then be secretive with information that may help.

As as a final note, as of this moment, while being within safe mode/trouble shooting mode, no tabs have crashed yet. Hope this is a sign, but I'll keep it on just to make sure the videos aren't crashing anymore.
creator: rwgamming

title: How do I revert to basic windows formatting instead of these stupid color themes forced on in update?
content:
I want my browser window to look like all my other windows. Why did you force these stupid themes on users? Why do developers always want to to tell/force others how they should use their computer?

COLOR CHANGES SHOULD HAVE BEEN AN OPTION, not a mandatory change. Realize YOU do not know how EVERYONE else wants to use their computer or have it look. Like, oh say, STANDARD WINDOWS formatting LIKE ALL MY OTHER WINDOWS. I LIKE IT THAT WAY. I don't care if you think that's boring, its not YOU using the computer.

SO - looking through all the searches MANY ARE REALLY UPSET, and there isn't an answer. SO What is the fix to get rid of the stupid themes? And don;t say "Oh, well maybe you will like nnnnn theme!" I KNOW what theme i want - I want it to match ALL MY OTHER WINDOWS. REALLY simple, yet your developers couldn't figure that out?

Or is only fix finally just switching to using chrome? Is that what you are trying to do?

FIX THIS.
creator: tkremin

title: How to disable sidebar or go back to view history in a tab?
content: Well, I don't know why they think it's a good idea to open the history in a sidebar, but it is quite harmful since very valuable information is lost, such as the date and time that a certain activity was carried out. This is why I stopped using Microsoft Edge a few months ago and to my horror see that Firefox just did the same thing. Leave history alone!
